text:
Hey Millie

Happy Friday! Its been a slightly busy week for me, sorry for  the delayed response. I am just eating lunch right now haha. I watched a WIP screening earlier today of the film I'm working on right now, which the start was as delayed during lunch

I'vey watched 2 or 3 episodes of Handmaid's Tale myself, but what I saw I thought was pretty well done.

I used to enjoy this photography magazine made where I am originally from in the U.S. called "Shots", which featured photography from all kinds of people. It was basically submission based, so I think anyone could get their photos in it if they sent them in and were selected. 

<https://shotsmag.com>

On the topic of analogue photography, have you ever developed your own film? I always wanted to try that, it's seems like such a nice thing to do, playing with light and really crafting the final image. 

Do you have any particular photographers or photography magazines you really like?

This looks pretty cool!
<https://www.tate.org.uk/whats-on/tate-modern/exhibition/shape-light>

attachments.title: SHOTS MAGAZINE
attachments.text: Shots magazine is a reader supported quarterly, printed journal of unusual fine-art B&W photography. Subscribe and submit for free.

attachments.title: Shape of Light: 100 Years of Photography and Abstract Art – Exhibition at Tate Modern | Tate
attachments.text: For the first time, Tate Modern tells the intertwined stories of photography and abstract art
attachments.fallback: Tate: Shape of Light: 100 Years of Photography and Abstract Art – Exhibition at Tate Modern | Tate

text: Oops sorry sent that before I meant to haha, it has at least a few typos, sorry about that :/

Thank you so much! I have seen shots magazine before, I've never thought to try an submit my work though, I will definitely be trying that! :grin: 
That must have been nice to watch the screening, what film are you working on? 
I've never developed my own film but I want to try it too :wink:
I have uploaded a lot of my photos onto a website called deviantart, do you know It? You're welcome to have a look at my online gallery, although I can't send you a direct link (sorry!) My username is just 
"MillieFerneSmith" if you'd like to see. 

(I'm sorry if this message wakes you up, I'm mostly nocturnal now! :sweat_smile:) 
Hope you're well, enjoy the weekend!
